description.narrative: Sverige kommer att ge kärnstöd till Resonance, en civilsamhällsorganisation baserad i den Transnistriska regionen av Moldavien (TN), under perioden juni 2016 - juni 2019. Kärnstöd ges för att stärka Resonance´s organisatoriska kapacitet och för att bidra till implementeringen av deras strategiska plan 2016-2019 inom området förebyggande och bekämpande av våld i hemmet i TN.

The Embassy of Sweden will support Resonance, a civil society organisation based in the Transnistrian region of the Republic of Moldova (TN), to implement core support activities provided by Resonance’s Strategic Plan during June 2016 - June 2019. Core support is granted to strengthen institutional capacities and to assist the implementation of Resonance’s medium term Strategic Plan 2016-2019 in the field of prevention and fighting domestic violence in TN.

The Embassy of Sweden will support Resonance, a civil society organisation based in the Transnistrian region of the Republic of Moldova, to implement core support activities provided by Resonance’s Strategic Plan during June 2016 - June 2019. Core support is granted to strengthen institutional capacities and to assist the implementation of Resonance’s medium term Strategic Plan 2016-2019 in the field of prevention and fighting domestic violence in Transnistria.

tag.narrative: 5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

description.narrative: 1. Strengthening the capacity of the Transnistrian platform for the prevention of domestic violence and the promotion of women's rights and elaboration of strategic planning for 2017 – 2020 with clear objectives and indicators. The efforts of the coalition was united to submit petition and advocate for changes in the legislation and institutional level to improve women’s rights. 16 Days Campaign managed to combine efforts of all women’s platform members. Resonance joined international StepUP campaign running by WAVE. 2. The new permanent Placement for shelter was officially commissioned in Tiraspol in February 2019. The new placement will be able to accept twice more women and children than the old temporary one in Bendery (12 places for adults and 4 places for children under 3 years old). It is the fist shelter in the Transniestrian region which meets international standards for shelters. 3. 357 beneficiaries (238 women, 115 children and 4 men) received services provided by the Crisis centre. 320 beneficiaries received long-term comprehensive support and worked to change their life situation. The cases of 220 beneficiaries are closed, of which 182 women (83% of completed cases) – managed to solve their problems and got out of the crisis situation (divorced with aggressors, drew up social benefits, alimony was withdrawn, women reside separately from aggressors, personal identification documents were drawn up, children started to attend educational establishments). 4. Within the framework of the Agreement signed in 2017 with the df Ministry of Internal Affairs, the two Plans of Joint Measures was approved and 17 activities for 276 local police officers, including df minister, df heads of duty units from all 7 regions, were implemented (round table with high-level police officers, trainings for acting police officers and graduate students, study visit). Since 2018 Informed Consent is mandatory for df police officers. This important tool for responding to cases of domestic violence allows df police officers to identify victims of domestic violence by asking victims to fill out this form and referring victims to the Women's Crisis Center for direct assistance. 5. In 2019 the Instruction for organizing the activities of employees of df internal affairs bodies to eliminate and prevent domestic violence was approved. The Crisis Center run by Resonance is defined in the Order as the institution where df police should refer identified women-victims of domestic violence. Center Resonance and the df MoI developed this instruction together. 6. 251 women and girls participated in the Women economic program – an unique program for women to increase their capacity and become economically independent (employment, entrepreneurship, consulting). 131 women have regular income and were employed. Starting from the end of 2017, 9 new business projects were launched (sewing manufacture, industrial alpinism, beauty services, producing eco-products, educational services for children).29 new jobs were created. 7. A Legal expertise to assess the compliance of de-facto legislation to international standards on combating gender-based violence and practice of implementation of current legislation by df police was drafted. This is a strong tool for advocacy of special legislation and institutional changes to respond to domestic violence.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
